head.title: 'Megan' Prosecutor To Head a State Division

hedline.hl1: 'Megan' Prosecutor To Head a State Division

abstract.p: Kathryn Flicker, former deputy attorney general who prosecuted Megan Kanka's killer, is named New Jersey Criminal Justice Division director (S)

block.p: The prosecutor who persuaded jurors to sentence Megan Kanka's killer to death was named the director of the State Division of Criminal Justice yesterday.

Kathryn Flicker, who prosecuted Jesse K. Timmendequas in the case that led to the passage of the sex-offender-registration requirement known as Megan's Law, is a former state deputy attorney general and assistant Mercer County prosecutor.
The prosecutor who persuaded jurors to sentence Megan Kanka's killer to death was named the director of the State Division of Criminal Justice yesterday.

Kathryn Flicker, who prosecuted Jesse K. Timmendequas in the case that led to the passage of the sex-offender-registration requirement known as Megan's Law, is a former state deputy attorney general and assistant Mercer County prosecutor.

Ms. Flicker will oversees 870 employees, including 150 lawyers and 340 investigators, who deal with white-collar crime, mob activities, bias and environmental crimes, and Medicaid and insurance fraud.
